==Events==
*[[495 BC]] &ndash; A newly constructed temple in honour of the god [[Mercury (mythology)|Mercury]] was dedicated in [[ancient Rome]] on the [[Circus Maximus]], between the [[Aventine Hill|Aventine]] and [[Palatine]] hills.  To spite the senate and the consuls, the people awarded the dedication to a [[Primus pilus|senior military officer]], [[Laetoria (gens)|Marcus Laetorius]]
* [[392]] &ndash; Emperor [[Valentinian II]] is assassinated while advancing into [[Gaul]] against the [[Franks|Frankish]] usurper [[Arbogast (general)|Arbogast]]. He is found hanging in his residence at [[Vienne]]. 
* [[589]] &ndash; King [[Authari]] marries [[Theodelinda]], daughter of the [[Bavaria]]n duke [[Garibald I of Bavaria|Garibald I]]. A [[Catholicism|Catholic]], she has great influence among the [[Lombards|Lombard]] nobility.
*[[1252]] &ndash; [[Pope Innocent IV]] issues the [[papal bull]] ''[[ad extirpanda]]'', which authorizes, but also limits, the torture of [[heretics]] in the [[Medieval Inquisition]].
*[[1525]] &ndash; [[Insurgency|Insurgent]] peasants led by [[Anabaptist]] pastor [[Thomas Müntzer]] were defeated at the [[Battle of Frankenhausen]], ending the [[German Peasants' War]] in the [[Holy Roman Empire]].
*[[1536]] &ndash; [[Anne Boleyn]], Queen of England, stands trial in London on  charges of treason, adultery and incest. She is condemned to death by a specially-selected [[jury]].
*[[1567]] &ndash; [[Mary, Queen of Scots]] marries [[James Hepburn, 4th Earl of Bothwell]], her third husband.
*[[1602]] &ndash; [[Bartholomew Gosnold]] becomes the first recorded European to see [[Cape Cod]].
*[[1618]] &ndash; [[Johannes Kepler]] confirms his previously rejected discovery of the [[Kepler's laws of planetary motion|third law of planetary motion]] (he first discovered it on [[March 8]] but soon rejected the idea after some initial calculations were made).
*[[1648]] &ndash; The [[Peace of Westphalia|Treaty of Westphalia]] is signed.
*[[1701]] &ndash; The [[War of the Spanish Succession]] begins.
*[[1718]] &ndash; [[James Puckle]], a London lawyer, patents the world's first [[machine gun]].
*[[1755]] &ndash; [[Laredo, Texas]] is established by the Spaniards.
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: the [[Virginia Convention]] instructs its [[Continental Congress]] delegation to propose a [[Lee Resolution|resolution of independence]] from Great Britain, paving the way for the [[United States Declaration of Independence]].
*[[1791]] &ndash; [[French Revolution]]: [[Maximilien Robespierre]] proposes the [[Self-denying_Ordinance_(French_Revolution)|Self-denying Ordinance]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; [[War of the First Coalition]]: France declares war on [[Kingdom of Sardinia]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[Diego Marín Aguilera]] flies a glider for "about 360 meters", at a height of 5–6 meters, during one of the first attempted manned flights.
*[[1796]] &ndash; [[First Coalition]]: [[Napoleon]] enters [[Milan]] in triumph.
*[[1800]] &ndash; King [[George III of the United Kingdom]] survives an assassination attempt by [[James Hadfield]], who is later acquitted by reason of insanity.
*[[1811]] &ndash; [[Paraguay]] declares independence from Spain.
*[[1817]] &ndash; Opening of the first private mental health hospital in the United States, the Asylum for the Relief of Persons Deprived of the Use of Their Reason (now [[Friends Hospital]]) in [[Philadelphia]], Pennsylvania.
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[Francis Baily]] observes "[[Baily's beads]]" during an [[annular eclipse]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; Troops of the [[Two Sicilies]] take [[Palermo]] and crush the republican government of [[Sicily]]
*[[1850]] &ndash; The [[Bloody Island Massacre]] takes place in [[Lake County, California]], in which a large number of Pomo Indians in Lake County are slaughtered by a regiment of the United States Cavalry, led by [[Nathaniel Lyon]].
*[[1858]] &ndash; Opening of the present [[Royal Opera House]] in [[Covent Garden]], London.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] signs a bill into law creating the United States Bureau of Agriculture. It is later renamed the [[United States Department of Agriculture]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Resaca]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] ends.
*  1864   &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of New Market]], [[Virginia]]: Students from the [[Virginia Military Institute]] fight alongside the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] Army to force [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] General [[Franz Sigel]] out of the [[Shenandoah Valley]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; [[Women's suffrage]]: in New York, [[Susan B. Anthony]] and [[Elizabeth Cady Stanton]] form the [[National Woman Suffrage Association]].
*[[1891]] &ndash; [[Pope Leo XIII]] defends [[Labor rights|workers' rights]] and property rights in the encyclical ''[[Rerum Novarum]]'', the beginning of modern [[Catholic social teaching]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Russo-Japanese War]]: The Russian [[minelayer]] ''Amur'' lays a [[Naval mine|minefield]] about 15 miles off [[Lüshunkou District|Port Arthur]] and sinks Japan's battleships [[Japanese battleship Hatsuse|''Hatsuse'']], 15,000 tons, with 496 crew and [[Japanese battleship Yashima|''Yashima'']].
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Las Vegas]], is founded when {{convert|110|acre|km2}}, in what later would become downtown, are auctioned off.
*[[1911]] &ndash; In ''[[Standard Oil Company of New Jersey v. United States]]'', the [[Supreme Court of the United States|United States Supreme Court]] declares [[Standard Oil]] to be an "unreasonable" [[monopoly]] under the [[Sherman Antitrust Act]] and orders the company to be broken up.
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[Winnipeg General Strike]] begins. By 11:00, almost the whole working population of [[Winnipeg, Manitoba]] had walked off the job.
*  1919   &ndash; Greek invasion of [[İzmir|Smyrna]]. During the invasion, the Greek army kills or wounds 350 [[Turkish people|Turks]]. Those responsible are punished by the Greek Commander Aristides Stergiades.
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Walt Disney]] character [[Mickey Mouse]] premieres in his first cartoon, [[Plane Crazy]]
*[[1929]] &ndash; A fire at the [[Cleveland Clinic]] in [[Cleveland, Ohio]] kills 123.
*[[1932]] &ndash; In an attempted [[coup d'état]], the [[Prime Minister of Japan]] [[Inukai Tsuyoshi]] is [[May 15 Incident|murdered]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[Kārlis Ulmanis]] establishes an authoritarian government in [[Latvia]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[Moscow Metro]] is opened to the public.
*[[1940]] &ndash; {{USS|Sailfish|SS-192|6}} is recommissioned. It was originally the USS ''Squalus''.
*  1940   &ndash; [[World War II]]: After fierce fighting, the poorly trained and equipped [[Netherlands|Dutch]] troops surrender to [[Nazi Germany|Germany]], marking the beginning of five years of occupation.
*  1940   &ndash; [[McDonald's]] opens its first restaurant in [[San Bernardino, California]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; First flight of the [[Gloster E.28/39]] the first British and Allied [[jet aircraft]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: in the United States, a bill creating the [[Women's Army Corps|Women's Army Auxiliary Corps]] (WAAC) is signed into law.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Joseph Stalin]] dissolves the [[Comintern]] (or ''Third International'').
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of Poljana]], the final skirmish in Europe is fought near [[Prevalje]], [[Slovenia]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; Following the demise of [[Mandatory Palestine]], the [[Kingdom of Egypt]], [[Jordan|Transjordan]], [[Lebanon]], [[Syria]], [[Iraq]] and [[Saudi Arabia]] invade [[Israel]] thus starting the [[1948 Arab–Israeli War]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; The Polish [[cultural attaché]] in Paris, [[Czesław Miłosz]], asks the French government for [[political asylum]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; Cubmaster [[Don Murphy (Cubmaster)|Don Murphy]] organized the first [[pinewood derby]], in [[Manhattan Beach, California]], by [[Los Angeles Area Council|Pack 280c]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; At [[Malden Island]] in the Pacific Ocean, Britain tests its first [[hydrogen bomb]] in [[Operation Grapple#Grapple|Operation Grapple]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] launches [[Sputnik 3]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; The Soviet Union launches [[Sputnik 4]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Project Mercury]]: The launch of the final Mercury mission, [[Mercury-Atlas 9]] with astronaut L. [[Gordon Cooper]] on board. He becomes the first American to spend more than a day in [[outer space|space]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; After a policy dispute, Prime Minister [[Nguyễn Cao Kỳ]] of [[South Vietnam]]'s ruling junta launches a military attack on the forces of General [[Tôn Thất Đính]], forcing him to abandon his command.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[People's Park (Berkeley)|People's Park]]: California Governor [[Ronald Reagan]] has an impromptu student park owned by University of California at Berkeley fenced off from student anti-war protestors, sparking a riot called Bloody Thursday.
*[[1970]] &ndash; President [[Richard Nixon]] appoints [[Anna Mae Hays]] and [[Elizabeth P. Hoisington]] the first female United States Army [[General (United States)|General]]s.
*  1970   &ndash; Philip Lafayette Gibbs and James Earl Green are killed at [[Jackson State University]] by police during [[Jackson State killings|student protests]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Okinawa Prefecture|Okinawa]], under U.S. military governance since its [[Battle of Okinawa|conquest]] in 1945, reverts to Japanese control.
*  1972   &ndash; In [[Laurel, Maryland]], [[Arthur Bremer]] shoots and paralyzes [[Governor of Alabama|Alabama Governor]] [[George Wallace]] while he is campaigning to become President.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Ma'alot massacre]]: Members of the [[Democratic Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] attack and take hostages at an [[Israel]]i school; a total of 31 people are killed, including 22 schoolchildren.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Elio de Angelis]], was killed while testing the [[Brabham BT55]] at the [[Circuit Paul Ricard|Paul Ricard]] circuit at [[Le Castellet, Var|Le Castellet]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The Soviet Union launches the [[Polyus (spacecraft)|Polyus]] prototype orbital weapons platform. It fails to reach orbit.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Soviet war in Afghanistan]]: After more than eight years of fighting, the [[Soviet Army]] begins its withdrawal from [[Afghanistan]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Édith Cresson]] becomes France's first female [[Prime Minister of France|premier]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The United States government acknowledges the existence of the [[Laotian Civil War|"Secret War" in Laos]] and dedicates the [[Laos Memorial]] in honor of [[Hmong people|Hmong]] and other "Secret War" veterans.
*[[2006]] &ndash; ''[[Cloud Gate]]'' was formally dedicated in Chicago's [[Millennium Park]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Same-sex marriage in California|California]] becomes the second [[U.S. state]] after [[Same-sex marriage in Massachusetts|Massachusetts]] in [[2004]] to legalize [[same-sex marriage]] after the state's own Supreme Court [[In re Marriage Cases|rules a previous ban unconstitutional]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Jessica Watson]] becomes the youngest person to sail, non-stop and unassisted around the world solo.
*[[2013]] &ndash; An [[May 2013 Iraq attacks|upsurge in violence]] in [[Iraq]] leaves more than 389 people dead over three days.
